alert.note: Alert for Lower Treasure Valley; Owyhee Mountains (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 5:19PM MDT by NWS Boise
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Owyhee and east central Malheur Counties through 600 PM MDT... At 519 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Slocum Creek Campground, or 36 miles southwest of Parma, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Slocum Creek Campground and Leslie Gulch around 520 PM MDT. Pelican Point around 530 PM MDT. Rockville School around 540 PM MDT. Succor Creek Campground and Board Corral Mountain around 550 PM MDT. Rockville and southern Owyhee Reservoir around 600 PM MDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. If on or near Owyhee Reservoir, get out of the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. Remember, lightning can strike out to 10 miles from the parent thunderstorm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM MDT for southeastern Oregon.
